alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 5:41AM EST until further notice by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Marshall, Fulton IN, Starke and Kosciusko Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Ora. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Extensive flooding of residences and low lying areas begins. At 15.0 feet, Near record flooding is in progress. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Saturday /3:30 AM CST Saturday/ the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM EST Saturday /3:30 AM CST Saturday/ was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.5 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.7 feet on 03/13/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
